Class Key

  • java.lang.Object
    • Key
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlackKey, WhiteKey

    public class Key
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a key on a piano. It has a note name, a frequency of the pitch, x/y coordinates, a width, a height, and a color. It has detects whether the key is pressed and is part of the play-along feature.
    Version:
    5/22/16
    Author:
    Dean Biskup and Julie Shen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Key(java.lang.String n, double f, double xCoord, double yCoord, double width, double height, java.awt.Color c)
      The constructor that creates a key of the piano.

      • Key

        public Key(java.lang.String n,
           double f,
           double xCoord,
           double yCoord,
           double width,
           double height,
           java.awt.Color c)
        The constructor that creates a key of the piano. There are 13 in total.
        Parameters:
        n - The name of the note
        f - The frequency of the pitch in Hertz
        xCoord - The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the key
        yCoord - The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the key
        width - The width of the key
        height - The height of the key
        c - The color of the key
